text:
Hello!

We tried to enable it there first (turns out not fully correctly), didn't work, so we tought it is the other way around.

Thanks!

Hey guys! How can i set an image with background:url(' ');

Using the id file i presum, but i don't now how

Hey guys! How can i set an image with background:url(' ');
Using the id file i suppose, but i don't now how
I'm not sure, sorry 4 my english xD

Do you mean sth like this in css or html file?

`background-image: url('{{ get_asset_url('../images/foo.jpg') }}');`
Anyone else find the new HS Developers Slack logo kind of hard to read, and not very distinctive if you're in a bunch of different Slack workspaces?
Hey <@U01BBV0L2CF> (and <@U01A2CWH59S>), we are def all about making sure we are inclusive to all, would something like this seem more recognizable?
the text and sprocket are the same sizes from the previous version

looks good now :blush:
The text is really required? maybe continues hard to read no?

It’s not, we can remove that too. I know the “developers” text was always hard to read in the old one too. We do have various other slack communities (such as our agency partners one) so I wanted to make sure in case folks are in those as well that there isnt just sprockets floating around all over lol
make sense, anyway, looks better now :blush:

Hi all. We host our website on HubSpot, and our product is a javascript web-app served through AWS/cloudfront. We would like to add help modals within our app and serve those pages from HubSpot. I’m not clear on how to get started researching this. The desired look is as follows. Any help would be much appreciated (our support site is already on HubSpot here: <https://support.ondema.io/support> )

Hi! Google Search Console flagged three mobile usability issues on one page of a client website. The issues are: Text too small to read, clickable elements too close together, and content wider than screen. I can't find anything that would be causing these issues, so I'd love another set of eyes. Thanks!

<https://www.finehomecontracting.com/about-us/>
maybe it's referring to your header elements?
